description: President Nelson said he chose London as the starting point of his global tour because of its international diversity. "It's a melting pot, and ours is a global ministry, so at least we can get a sample," he said. "Most of the nations of the world are here in London."

bullets.text: After 'electric' general conference, U.K. Mormons eager to see, hear President Nelson in London
Melting pot of Mormons to greet President Nelson Thursday, hoping to reach irreligious Europeans
The 'why?' behind President Nelson’s global tour shared during first stop in London
'The Lord's message is for everyone': President Nelson talks about global tour

description: Cutting his stay in Jerusalem short as a result of rising tensions in in the Middle East, President Nelson left the central location of his global ministry tour following conference sessions at the BYU Jerusalem Center.

bullets.text: President Nelson arrives in Holy Land, 'where it all happened'
President Nelson cancels visits to local sites, leaves Jerusalem as tensions rise in Middle East

description: East African Mormons traveled hundreds of miles in dust covered busses to hear President Nelsons voice in person. They received messages tailored for eastern Africa as the prophet addressed issues such as the practice of dowry.

bullets.text: Mormon Kenyans jubilantly await President Nelson, hope visit helps reduce persecution
‘Dowry is not the Lord’s way’: In Kenya, LDS President Nelson says tithing breaks poverty cycle

description: President Nelson follows in the footsteps of President Gordon B. Hinckley's 1998 tour as he travels to South Africa to speaks to members in Harare.
After announcing a temple in Bengaluru, India, President Nelson will travel to the city and meet with members of the church in that area.
President Nelson will speak to saints in Thailand, who have grown from just over 1000 members in 1973 when the first Thailand mission was organized, to now almost 21,000 members.
Home to one temple and about 25,000 members, Hong Kong is second to last on President Nelson's tour.
President Nelson will speak to members and students at Brigham Young University-Hawaii. This is his last stop on his world tour.
